sentences.en: An importunate request an insistent or pressing demand.
sentences.cn: 强求胡搅蛮缠的要求;持续的或迫切的要求.

sentences.en: Computer won't make mistake, bagman importunate is saying.
sentences.cn: 电脑是不会出错的, 推销员坚持的说着.

sentences.en: From that time he was the most humble, modest, and importunate man alive in his courtship.
sentences.cn: 从那时候起他变做世上最自谦, 最有礼貌, 最屡求不倦的求婚人了.

sentences.en: His secretary shielded him from importunate visitors.
sentences.cn: 他的秘书替他挡住胡搅蛮缠的来访者。

sentences.en: I felt the reasons for your silence, and I feared to seem importunate, by writing.
sentences.cn: 我感觉到你保持缄默事出有因, 给你写信会使你觉得我纠缠不休.

sentences.en: I imagined it was some importunate person who - I beg you will excuse me.
sentences.cn: 我还以为是什么人无故前来纠缠,望勿见怪.

sentences.en: I would not have our gratitude become indiscreet or importunate.
sentences.cn: 我不愿意让我们的感激变成失礼或勉强.

sentences.en: She was importunate for the return of her money.
sentences.cn: 她纠缠不休地要求退还她的钱.

sentences.en: Tatyana refused to give in to his importunate declarations.
sentences.cn: 达吉雅娜对他缠扰不休的爱情的表白丝毫不为所动.

sentences.en: The importunate memory was kept before her by its ironic contrast to her present situation.
sentences.cn: 萦绕在心头的这个回忆对当前的情景来说,是个具有讽刺性的对照.

sentences.en: This is our country must long - term importunate a basic national policy.
sentences.cn: 这是我国必须 长期 坚持的一项基本国策.

sentences.en: You should convince people by reasoning , instead of being importunate.
sentences.cn: 你要以理服人, 不要胡缠.

words.tran_cn: 讨厌的；急切的；缠扰不休的

trans.tran_en: continuously asking for things in an annoying or unreasonable way
